column4: audio_setup: Can't open audio device /dev/dsp: Device or resource busy
Could not open/initialize audio device -> no sound.
this happens when I try to play something in mplayer

you're running GNOME, which runs the Enlightened sound daemon, which keeps control of the soundcard at all times. You must have an onboard or bargain-counter sound card like me that doesn't accept multiple sounds at the same time.
you'll need to configure mplayer to use esd as its audio output... can you at least run the mplayer gui?

it's been a while since I used mplayer (I fell in love with xine because it Just Worked for me), I don't remember where it is, but it's configurable from a menu somewhere (i.e., you don't have to go farting around in a config file)
heh heh... you're obviously doing something above and beyond my level of knowledge ^_^ I believe that if you use alsa as an output, it won't conflict with esd
thanks anyway, I just killed esd for now :D

I believe that, if you use alsa as an output, it will play nice with esd... if your card doesn't support hardware mixing, mplayer will take control of the sound card, but it'll give control back to esd when it's done. What platform are you using?
I think I would need to have esd-alsa installed
not by choice, that's what was installed for me with warty
really?!? must be a difference between PPC and x86 -- ALSA works lovely for me.
